sites.title: How Long To Beat
sites.description: If you want to manage your game backlog or share what you are playing, this site is awesome. I'm currently using it to manage my /now page.

sites.title: Vimm's Lair
sites.description: Some of my favourite games of all time are now considered retro, and if you are into game preservation you'll find that Vimm's Lair has an enormous database you can browse through.

sites.title: Game accessibility guidelines
sites.description: If you are a game developer and are concerned with the accessibility of your games, you should check out this site.

sites.title: Godot Shaders
sites.description: A community driven shader library for the Godot game engine.

sites.title: Kenney's Game Assets
sites.description: Kenney has ammassed a gigantic collection of free-to-use game assets, from 2D to 3D to UI.

sites.title: Azgaar's Fantasy Map Generator
sites.description: Fantasy maps is something I love looking at, from Lord of the Rings to The Witcher. But if you ever wanted to make one for yourself, check out Azgaar's.

sites.title: Watabou's Procgen Arcana
sites.description: If you liked Azhaar's, Watabou's offers an array of different map generators from cities, villages and dungeons.

sites.title: The Dungeon Master's Vault
sites.description: An online service for D&D5e players and Dungeon Masters to generate character sheet and other resources.

sites.title: Mythological Figures (for D&D5e)
sites.description: A collection of NPC stat blocks based on mythological and historic figures.

sites.title: NPC Statblock Compendium
sites.description: A PDF full of NPC stat blocks based on character classes and races for D&D5e.

sites.title: Simon Dann's website
sites.description: Blog and general digital garden of the full stack programmer Simon Dann.

sites.title: Cory Dransfeldt's website
sites.description: Blog of the software developer Cory Dransfeldt where he writes about software development, technology and music.

sites.title: Sophie Koonin's website
sites.description: Sophie builds fun things out of HTML, CSS & JavaScript, and writes blog posts about tech and mental health.

sites.title: the museum of alexandra
sites.description: Alexandra's personal website is an inspiration in both style and the sheer amount of content shared. If you want inspiration to start your own personal site, be sure to check hers out.

sites.title: 32-Bit cafe
sites.description: If you miss the old-school feel of the Internet before it was profitable for corporations, check out the info and resources provided by the 32-Bit cafe.

sites.title: Modern Font Stacks
sites.description: System font stack CSS organized by typeface classification for every modern OS.

sites.title: The Old Net
sites.description: A set of resources based around The Old Internet.

sites.title: HTML for the people
sites.description: Blake Watson's project to help people learn to make websites with HTML without previous experience.
